text: Papier-mâché sculpture of Lion or Turkey Fish Cast Paper is a paper crafting technique in which paper fiber or pulp, such as cotton fiber paper, is formed using a mold. The pulp may consist of pure fiber, or be an amalgam of fiber, binder, and filler, such as Papier-mâché. The technique is employed for in- the-round sculpture as well as bas-relief. ==See also== * Art movement * Creativity techniques * List of art media * List of artistic media * List of art movements * List of art techniques * List of most expensive paintings * List of most expensive sculptures * List of sculptors ==References== Category:Paper art Category:Artistic techniques Category:Decorative arts
title: Cast paper
